entry.title: Unit tests
entry.summary: The context provided is a brief conversation between two individuals. The first person mentions pull requests 363 and 442, indicating that they hope these get approved soon. They express their frustration with having tests spread out across different forks, finding it confusing to keep track of them. This conversation appears to be related to a software development project, where the individuals are likely discussing changes to code or adding new features. Pull requests are typically used in this context as a way to propose changes and have them reviewed by other members of the team before they are merged into the main codebase. Overall, it seems that the first person wishes for greater organization within the testing process to simplify things moving forward. It remains unclear what specific changes have been proposed in pull requests 363 and 442, but their approval would seemingly help address some of these concerns.
